titleStmt.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard, April 4, 1887

bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to Thomas F. Bayard
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Mr. S. S. Sevier
To the Secy of State.
Digest Invoice Book. Arrivals and Departures of American vessels. record of official fees. Summary of Consular Business. Abstracts of contingent Expenses Account for salary. Account for cable-gram.

Hon. T. F. Bayard
Secy of State
Washington D.C.
I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith the returns for the quarter ending March 31, 1887 of this Consulate General. Please find the same to be as follows:

Digest of the Invoice Book (1) Arrivals and departures of American vessels (2) Record
Record of official fees (3) Summary of Consular business (4) Abstract of Contingent expenses (5) Account for salary (6) Account for cable-gram (7).
The returns for Gold Coast are not enclosed because up to this time they have not been received.

I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your obedient servant
Sam'l S. Sevier
U.S. Vice Consul Genl

1. Digest of Invoice Book
2. Arrival & Departures
3. Record of official fees &c.
